results.firPara: Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool have not atoned for recent results with their impressive defeat of Tottenham Hotspur but set the standard for realising Jürgen Klopps dream of winning every remaining game.
results.secPara: The Liverpool manager said before Spurs visit to Anfield that he dreamed of 14 consecutive league victories, despite going into the contest with only one win in 10 matches. Henderson, who convened a team meeting at Melwood last Thursday in response to the poor run, insists Liverpools performance against Mauricio Pochettinos team indicated Klopps target is not as fanciful as it appears.
results.webTitle: Jordan Henderson: Liverpool up for Klopp aim to win every game in run-in

results.firPara: This was a slog for Manchester City, but after a fiercely contested game on the south coast against opponents who refused to wilt it should probably be considered evidence that Pep Guardiolas side will pose the most credible threat to Chelseas advantage at the top of the Premier League. City have sprung into second place, taking advantage of the leaders slight stutter on Sunday at Burnley and Guardiola could arguably draw more positives from this hard-fought victory than the 4-0 thrashing they had inflicted on West Ham United in their previous away fixture.
results.secPara: That had proved a stroll at the London Sadium but, confronted by opponents yet to win a game in 2017, City had to scrap to impose themselves. In the autumn, once Citys scintillating start to life under Guardiola had petered out, they might have shrunk in the face of the resistance offered by an energetic and eager Bournemouth team.
results.webTitle: Sergio Agüero makes his point in Manchester City’s win at Bournemouth

results.firPara: Goals from Raheem Sterling and substitute Sergio Agüero – via a Tyrone Mings deflection – gave Manchester City a hard-fought win that puts them second in the table, eight points behind Chelsea
results.secPara: Thats your lot. Three wins in a row for City, who climb to second in the table. They were made to work hard by Bournemouth in a bruising encounter but a little extra class, plus goals from Raheem Sterling and substitute Sergio Agüero (via Tyrone Mings) made the difference. Bournemouth stay six points off the bottom three, but if they play like that every week, will not be in any danger of going down. Thanks for joining me. Bye!
results.webTitle: Bournemouth 0-2 Manchester City: Premier League – as it happened

results.firPara: Sacking managers is the traditional response for teams in trouble but there are no easy ways to beat the drop and time is running out for the top flights bottom six
results.secPara: Sacking managers is the traditional response for teams in trouble but there are no easy ways to beat the drop and time is running out for the top flights bottom six
results.webTitle: Dilemmas mount for clubs engaged in Premier League relegation dogfight | Louise Taylor

results.firPara: Channels such as Arsenal Fan TV claim they give supporters the chance to have their say but are viewers just hoping to watch a car-crash moment?
results.secPara: It was freezing outside the Emirates Stadium but that had not stopped the crowd. Small children were hoisted on the shoulders of their parents and one adult was holding a sign that read #no bad energy. All in all there must have been at least 200 people craning to hear a chartered accountant share his views on a hum-drum victory against Hull City. And they were all standing in absolute silence.
results.webTitle: Fan TV: revolution or just a vehicle for venting attention-grabbing fury? | Paul MacInnes

results.firPara: Slaven Bilic, the West Ham United manager, has been charged with improper conduct following the game against West Bromwich Albion on Saturday, the Football Association has announced.
results.secPara: Bilic picked up and hurled a television microphone and appeared to abuse the referee, Michael Oliver, after his team conceded a late equaliser in the 2-2 draw. He was sent to the stands as a result.
results.webTitle: West Ham’s Slaven Bilic charged by FA after hurling microphone in anger

results.firPara: In todays Fiver Uncle Pep, Karl Robinson and the intrigue at Ibrox
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Uncle Pep, Karl Robinson and the intrigue at Ibrox
results.webTitle: The Fiver | A relentless Sensible Soccer sprite that can subsist on goals alone

results.firPara: For the first time in weeks, it feels like there will be a relegation battle in Spain after all. And Leganés will be in it
results.secPara: Sporting Gijón havent got a prayer, but they might just have a little hope at last. The miracle arrived in the week they stopped asking for it – and the week they needed it most. The week Granada and Osasuna needed it, too. Resurrection Sunday, one headline called it, and it was huge a match that felt like all their fates hung on it, even with 17 weeks still to go. We have to win, come what may; we cant afford another defeat, the Sporting coach Joan Ferrer, Rubi, said. Salvation will depend largely on what we do at Butarque; its very important to win, the Leganés coach Asier Garitano said. As for Father Fernando Fueyo, he didnt say anything.
results.webTitle: Sporting Gijón drag Leganés back and give La Liga a relegation battle | Sid Lowe

results.firPara: Their late win at Ingolstadt was the spirit of Old Bayern, as they are perceived nationally, and made it 25 points from 27 to go seven points clear at the to
results.secPara: There simply had to be some sort of tribute and, in the event, there was more than one, conscious and subconscious. As Bayern Munich worked to just about chisel out a win at struggling Ingolstadt – which ultimately proved to be even more valuable than it might have first appeared – it was impossible to ignore the context of the match, unfolding just four days after Philipp Lahm confirmed that he would indeed be retiring from football at the seasons close.
results.webTitle: Bayern Munich begin Philipp Lahm send-off in time-honoured tradition | Andy Brassell

results.firPara: The Delfini are suffering one of the worst seasons of any club in Serie A history, a rout at Torino coming fresh off an arson attack at their presidents house
results.secPara: The Delfini are suffering one of the worst seasons of any club in Serie A history, a rout at Torino coming fresh off an arson attack at their presidents house
results.webTitle: Pescara endure ugliest of weeks as their dire season goes up in smoke | Paolo Bandini
